Organism_Record.Function_Summary: Forms the phage shell; binds to the phage RNA.

Funtion.Detail: The action of a molecule that contributes to the structural integrity of a complex or assembly within or outside a cell.

Viral protein that forms an icosahedral capsid with a T=3 symmetry to protect the viral genome. The T=3 capsid is composed of 180 subunits, each subunit occupying a quasi-equivalent position. The capsid diameter ranges from 26 to 40 nm.
Interacting selectively and non-covalently with an RNA molecule or a portion thereof.
